senses.sense_definition: A set of standard rules that allows electronic devices to communicate with each other and exchange data.

examples.text: The website uses a secure <w>protocol</w> to protect your credit card information.
Engineers are developing a new wireless <w>protocol</w> for faster data transfer.

senses.sense_definition: A system of fixed rules and formal behavior used at official meetings, especially between governments, or within a specific group.

examples.text: It is considered a breach of <w>protocol</w> to sit down before the Queen does.
The ambassador was well versed in diplomatic <w>protocol</w> and knew exactly how to greet the foreign dignitaries.

senses.sense_definition: A precise plan or set of instructions for carrying out a scientific experiment or medical treatment.

examples.text: The hospital has a strict <w>protocol</w> for handling infectious diseases to ensure staff safety.
Scientists must follow the experimental <w>protocol</w> exactly to obtain valid results.

senses.sense_definition: An official international agreement, or an amendment to an existing treaty.

examples.text: Several nations signed the environmental <w>protocol</w> to reduce carbon emissions globally.
The new <w>protocol</w> adds specific trade regulations to the original agreement.

senses.sense_definition: To create an official record or draft of a document or agreement.

examples.text: The secretary <w>protocolled</w> the minutes of the meeting for future reference.
They <w>protocoled</w> the terms of the agreement before the final signing ceremony.
